contest-event.event-date:
Aug. 10, 1857 D Scarborough Contest
Scarborough Contest 10 Other Scarborough Contest scarborough-contest
Beauties of Scarbro'
Castle Yard, Scarborough See http://www.ibew.org.uk/misc42.htm
Two classes of competitors. The first class prizes to be £20, £8, and a splendid new cornet, with German silver valves, value £5 5s, presented by Mr Townsend, of Bradford, musical instrument maker. The second class to consist of three prizes, viz, £7, £5, and £3. The bands will play two pieces each, one of their own selection, and one composed for the occasion by Mr A. J. Peckett - a set of waltzes, entitled the "Beauties of Scarbro' ". The first prize of the first class was twenty sovereigns for the best brass band, and £8 for the second best; and for the third best brass band a splendid first-class cornet, with German silver valves, valued at five guineas, presented by Mr. Townshend, musical instrument manufacturer, Bradford.
July 19, 2011, 9:35 p.m. Jan. 24, 2012, 2:19 p.m.
1 Hull Druids Richard Smith
2 Leeds Joppa Operatic Richard Smith
3 Dewsbury Temperance John Peel
Unknown Result Darlington Saxhorn H. Hoggett
Unknown Result Ossett Temperance Richard Smith
Unknown Result Whitby Volunteer W. Mercer
